Re: License #: CI370377212
Special Investigation #: 2023C0000790SI
Dear Mrs. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*** This report contains quoted profanity***
***This report contains sexually implicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI370377212
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Tyrene Reginald Green
Chief Administrator: Marci Canales
Agency Name: New Hope Youth Center
Agency Address: 1719 E HIGH ST
MT PLEASANT, MI 48858-8989
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 04/09/2025
Capacity: 15

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth reported having sex with a staff member.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on 9/27/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Courtesy Worker 2. Youth A
reported she had previously been at New Hope and completed the
program. Youth A reported she liked the staff at New Hope as the
staff were “good” and staff never did anything to her. Youth A was
asked if she had made any allegations about any staff at New
Hope. Youth A reported Staff 1 “touched me down there” and
upon clarifying with Youth A, Youth A reported “down there” meant
her vagina. Youth A reported she had a single bedroom at the
facility and Staff 1 came into her bedroom at her bedtime. Staff 1
touch her vagina under her clothing. Staff 1 did not say anything
prior, during, or after he touched her vagina. Youth A reported
Staff 1 touched the outside of her vagina, he did not digitally
penetrate her. Youth A was laying in her bed. Youth A reported
Staff 1 heard someone coming and stopped. Youth A reported
someone came to her bedroom door and Staff 1 left her bedroom,
however Youth A did not remember who the person was that
came to her bedroom door. Youth A reported this was the first and
2

only time this happened. Youth A reported it happened
approximately two months ago. Youth A did not recall the day it
occurred but reported it was one month before she left the facility.
Youth A was able to provide a description of Staff 1. Youth A
reported her bedtime was 9:30pm on the weekend and 8pm
during the week. Youth A reported she did not tell anyone about
this. Youth A did not remember how Staff 1 was positioned when
he touched her vagina, whether he was sitting on the bed or
standing next to the bed. Youth A did not remember how long
Staff 1 was in her bedroom. Youth A did not remember what Staff
1 was wearing. Youth A did not remember what she was wearing.
Youth A did not remember what the youth did that day at the
facility in order to try to determine when the incident occurred.
Youth A did not recall any of the youth that would have been at
New Hope when this occurred. Youth A reported no other staff
made her feel uncomfortable at New Hope. Youth A reported she
never had sexual intercourse with any staff at New Hope.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at school on 10/6/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B was at the
facility while Youth A was placed there. Youth B reported Staff 1
no longer works at the facility and has been gone for several
months. Youth B reported youth are not allowed to go upstairs
alone with male staff. Youth B reported she was not aware of any
youth being upstairs alone with a male staff. Youth B did not have
any knowledge of any youth claiming a male staff was in their
bedroom.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at school on 10/6/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C was at the
facility while Youth A was placed there. Youth C reported male
staff cannot be alone at the house with the youth and explained
this by saying if there is staff that need to take youth on an outing,
there always must be a female staff at the house with the youth
that are not going on the outing. Male staff can be in the living
room with youth without a female staff being present however a
male staff is not able to go upstairs without having a female staff
with them. Youth C reported there was a time where Staff 5 was
upstairs with Youth D and was talking to Youth D when she was
escalated. Youth C reported she did not have any concerns with
the male staff at the facility regarding boundaries. Youth C
reported she was not aware of Staff 1 going into any of the youth’s
bedrooms. Youth C reported Staff 1 no longer works at the facility
and that she really liked Staff 1 as he was a “good staff” as he was
understanding and respectful to youth.
3

Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/28/2023. Administrator reported Youth A did not have any home
visits in June when she was at the facility. Staff 1 worked various
shifts at the facility however he did not work overnights. Staff 1 no
longer works at the facility and his last day was July 21, 2023.
Administrator reported there were never concerns verbalized to
her of Staff 1 being sexually inappropriate with youth. Youth A did
have a bedroom by herself while she was at the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 10/18/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Courtesy Worker. Staff 1 reported
he no longer works at the facility and has not worked at the facility
since the end of July 2023. Staff 1 reported he knows Youth A as
she was a youth at the facility when he worked there. Staff 1 only
interacted with Youth A when Youth A was escalated and if he
needed to assist in restraining her. Staff 1 reported he was not a
floor staff and was not responsible for day-to-day interactions with
the youth. Staff 1 reported Youth A escalated easily and had
unpredictable behaviors. Youth A would make statements while
being restrained by male staff including “fuck me”, “rape me”, “I
like that”. Staff 1 reported male staff do not go upstairs where the
youth bedrooms are. If a youth needs something from upstairs
and a female staff is not available to take the youth upstairs, then
the male staff goes upstairs and will get whatever the youth needs
and bring it back downstairs. Youth normally would not be
allowed to go upstairs to get something, staff would do it for them.
Staff 1 reported there are always more female staff at the facility
than male staff. Staff 1 reported there is not a facility policy that
states male staff are not allowed upstairs however it is best
practice for male staff not to go upstairs without a female staff
present. Staff 1 reported he never had any sexual contact with
Youth A. Staff 1 was not aware of Youth A making any sexual
allegations against him. Staff 1 reported he was never upstairs
alone with Youth A in her bedroom. Staff 1 reported he was never
alone with Youth A at all. Staff 1 reported he never had sex with
Youth A or any youth at the facility. Staff 1 reported he never
placed his hand down Youth A’s pants and never touch Youth A’s
vagina. Staff 1 reported he has not had any communication with
Youth A or any of the youth from the facility since he no longer
works there. Staff 1 reported he does not know why Youth A
would make these allegations against him. Staff 1 reported he no
longer works at the facility due to having difference with
administrative staff and due to issues regarding him being able to
get to work on time due to traveling from a distance.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/6/2023. Staff 2 reported no concerns with any male staff being
sexually inappropriate with any youth that have been at the facility.
Youth A did make statements while she was in restraints by male
staff. Staff 2 reported Youth A would make statements including
“fuck me”, “rape me”, and “you’re touching my vagina”. Staff 2
was not aware of Youth A ever making any allegations regarding
male staff. Staff 2 did not have any knowledge of any male staff
ever going into Youth A’s bedroom. Staff 2 reported female staff
are responsible for taking youth upstairs at the facility. If a youth
needs to get upstairs to get something and a female staff is
unavailable, a male staff will go upstairs to unlock the door while
youth wait at the bottom of the staircase. Once the male staff
returns downstairs from unlocking the door that is at the top of the
stairs, then the youth can go upstairs to get what they need. At
night, male staff are only upstairs if they are with a female staff.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 no longer works at the facility however did
not know why.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/6/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3
reported no concerns with any male staff being sexually
inappropriate with any youth that have been at the facility. Staff 3
did not have any knowledge of any allegations of any male staff
touching Youth A sexually. Staff 3 reported male staff do not go
upstairs unless they are with a female staff. The only time a male
staff would be upstairs without a female staff would be if a youth
ran upstairs to get something such as headphones and the male
staff would watch from halfway up the staircase. Staff 3 reported
this would be very uncommon.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/6/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4
reported no concerns with any male staff being sexually
inappropriate with any youth that have been at the facility. Staff 4
reported Youth A would make statements while in restraints with
male staff. Youth A would say “rape me dad” but no other
knowledge of youth alleging any inappropriate interactions with
male staff. Youth A did have a bedroom by herself. Staff 4
reported male staff only do bedroom checks on youth when a
female staff is present. Staff 4 reported the only time a male staff
would be upstairs alone with youth would be if a male staff got
mandated for the night shift. Staff 4 never heard any allegations
about a male staff member going into Youth A’s bedroom.
5

Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
10/2/2023. Foster Care Worker reported there is lack of
creditability in Youth A’s allegations as Youth A has a pattern of
making accusations regarding sexual abuse after leaving
placements. Youth A made allegations in 2021, 2022, and now
the current allegations. The allegations were investigated in 2021
and 2022 and found to be untrue. In 2022 Youth A alleged the
same allegations at another facility stating she had sex with a
male staff and believed she was pregnant. Youth A completed
pregnancy tests several times and all the pregnancy tests were
negative in 2022. Youth A obtained medical treatment and it was
learned through medical professionals that Youth A was a virgin
after making the allegations in 2022. Youth A has not had any
home passes as Youth A does not have home passes. Youth A
has never reported any concerns to Foster Care Worker regarding
staff being sexually inappropriate with her.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 10/4/2023 and
reported they had no further information.
MDHHS Worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s Employee Separation Report: Staff 1 was released
from employment at New Hope Youth Center on 7/21/2023
due to attendance issues.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had no discipline related to
the allegations.
• New Hope Youth Center staff schedule for July 2023. Staff
1 was not listed on the schedule after 7/21/2023. Staff 1
was scheduled various days from 7/1/2023-7/21/2023 from
6am until 10:15pm. A majority of the shifts Staff 1 was
scheduled, he was scheduled as the shift supervisor.
• Youth Opportunity Staff Code of Ethics Policy and
Procedure: Staff must not socialize with youth on a
personal level, enter into a romantic relationship with past
or present residents, or engage in any sexual or intimate
contact with youth.
• Youth A’s MiSACWIS case file: Youth A was placed at New
Hope Youth Center from 4/14/2022-8/30/2023. Youth A is a
permanent court ward and did not have any off-campus
visits in June or July 2023.
Video Reviewed:
6

Video footage was unable to be reviewed due to the alleged
incident occurring in June or July and video footage not being
stored for that long.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance. Youth A changed her story
from the alleged allegations that she had sex with a male staff at
New Hope and believed she was pregnant to reporting Staff 1
placed his hand down her pants on her vagina two months ago
while Youth A was laying in her bed for bedtime. Staff 1 denies
that this occurred as well as there are no other staff or youth that
saw or had any knowledge of this occurring.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
10/20/2023
